required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Group Commitment Contracts on Smoking Cessation
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Group Commitment Contracts on Smoking Cessation

lead_sponsor.agency: National Bureau of Economic Research, Inc.

clinical_study.source: National Bureau of Economic Research, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine whether information about and/or take-up of group commitment contracts has an impact on smoking cessation.

primary_outcome.description: Participants will be directly prompted to answer whether they have been able to quit smoking in the past six months. If a participant self-reports a claim of smoking cessation, they will be asked to biochemically verify their claim at a Quest Diagnostics location. Verification will be derived from a urine test screening for metabolites of tobacco.

other_outcome.description: Participants will be directly prompted to answer whether they have been able to quit smoking in the past six months. If a participant self-reports a claim of smoking cessation, they will be asked to biochemically verify their claim at a Quest Diagnostics location. Verification will be derived from a urine test screening for metabolites of tobacco.

Participants will be directly prompted to answer whether they have been able to quit smoking in the past six months. If a participant self-reports a claim of smoking cessation, they will be asked to biochemically verify their claim at a Quest Diagnostics location. Verification will be derived from a urine test screening for metabolites of tobacco.

Participants will be directly prompted to answer whether they have been able to quit smoking in the past six months. If a participant self-reports a claim of smoking cessation, they will be asked to biochemically verify their claim at a Quest Diagnostics location. Verification will be derived from a urine test screening for metabolites of tobacco.

intervention.description: A group contract where the primary individual, who will be tracked by the study, can invite between 1 and 3 peers to join the contract and form their group. To initiate a quit smoking contract, a user must choose: the duration in weeks during which the contract members need to quit smoking; the stake each member must put in; and, optionally, to allow other members to have the power to invite other people to join the group.
Individuals eligible for a $100 monetary reward (incentive) following biochemically-verified smoking cessation.
Individuals will have the opportunity to create an individual commitment contract to quit smoking. They will have the option to set money at stakes and how many weeks the contract will last.

In the initial survey, participants will receive additional information treatments on the likelihood of success of the different incentives and contracts, with the goal of shifting "naives" to "sophisticates."

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 18 years or older
- Daily smoker
- Has smartphone with capability to reach internet daily and download app
- Able and willing to visit Quest location
- Has or can create a Paypal or Venmo account
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Any terminal illness

facility.name: Northwestern University, Global Poverty Research Lab
